seo_keywords: Shark Rotator brush roll indicator red

problems.title: Brush Roll Indicator Light is Red
problems.description: The brush roll stops spinning and the light on the nozzle turns red.
possible_causes: Brush roll is jammed with debris
solution_steps: Remove the bottom cover (3 locks) and cut away hair.
Check the nozzle hose for blockages.

problems.title: Loss of Suction / Hissing Noise
problems.description: Vacuum isn't picking up dirt and sounds like air is escaping.
solution_steps: Check the hose near the handle for tears.
Wash the foam and felt filters.
If filters are crumbling, replace them immediately to save the motor.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Rotator Professional Lift-Away (NV501)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $367 vacuum, and extending the life of your Shark is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Rotator Professional Lift-Away (NV501) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Rotator Professional Lift-Away (NV501) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
